channel.title: [Hyperion] Subtile
channel.description:
[center][b]Introduction:[/b][/center]
Hello Moparscape. Welcome to the [i]Subtile[/i] development thread. This will be hyperion based. Now, I know what you're thinking, "Hyperion is to hard to understand." Well, I chose it for the stability. I was debating between Runesource, or this, and I chose this, obviously. Anyways, I didn't choose it just for the stability. I don't know about you all, but I like a challenge. As most of you know, hyperion is "bare bones" and that's why I like it. You actually have to focus on the core. From what I have seen, there hasn't been many hyperion releases at all. I plan on getting far in this project, i'm not going to quit half-way like most others do. This project will take awhile to complete. I'm thinking somewhere around 4-6 months. I am putting everything I have into this project.
[center][b]Plans:[/b][/center]
As of now, my main focus is working on packet/packet handlers. In the near future, I will begin writing the skills. I know this isn't going to be easy, but as I have said before, I am committed to this project. Even though finals are coming up in a week or so, I am still working on this, non-stop. I want players to realize that Hyperion does have some potential. It would be nice to see Hyperion being used, sometime in the future. I do hope by working on this project, I will inspire others to do as I am. Anyways, I am taking my time on everything, no matter how small it is. I want everything to be perfect.
[center][b]More Information:[/b][/center]
Going into this project, I realized I had a long road ahead of me. Many of you may be wondering if this is going to be released. Well, yes it is, but I will say one thing, I have thousands of things I need to complete before I even think about a release. If you want to get in touch with me, please, don't hesitate to PM me. I love the support I am receiving, so please, whatever you have to do, keep the positive 'reactions' coming! It motivates me! Oh, and please note, I will post pictures in the future, as of now, there isn't really anything to take pictures of, since I am just now beginning this project.

item.title: [Hyperion] Subtile
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Hope you learn a good amount of things working with Hyperion. I have learned so much in the last few months with Hyperion than I ever did with anything else.

Hope to see a real milestone in the near future. Don’t let the span of time it’s going to take put you off.

Read full topic

He’s not saying there’s an obvious reason to why he would pick Hyperion over Runesource, he’s saying he’s obviously already picked Hyperion over runesource, as you can see in the name of thread, being that there is a [Hyperion] in there.

Do you understand now?

item.title: [Hyperion] Subtile
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:11, topic:441835”][quote author=Native^ link=topic=544517.msg3991595#msg3991595 date=1336660829]
I don’t see why you “obviously” would chose Hyperion over Runesource. But good luck, we need more people developing Hyperion or Runesource instead of PI
[/quote]
In my opinion I would simply chose Hyperion since it is more object oriented (I haven’t read over RuneSource, but I know it was meant to simulate Delta just with better networking).

@OP Good luck. I had the same project basically as you until Apollo came out and I switched to that. Will be watching this.[/quote]

RuneSource was made as a substitute for the WinterLove framework, like a proof of concept like Winterlove showing that you can in fact have a high performing framework that uses the WinterLove design. One of the pit offs of this is the low amount of OO in it, Hyperion is a high performing framework but is also fucked by its design and use of the Mini library. Apollo can be considered a rewrite of Hyperion but far more OO a far better design, far more dynamic in the way you can add content.

Read full topic
